intro: Jumellea stipitata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and a single, upright stem that terminates in a yellow flower head. The plant is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. Jumellea stipitata is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some regions due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
